articles.title: “Homo juluensis”: Scientists Claim To Have Discovered New Species of Humans - SciTechDaily
articles.description: Researcher Christopher J. Bae identified Homo juluensis, a new human species that coexisted with Denisovans in Asia. A University of Hawaiʻi researcher may have identified a new human species, Homo juluensis, which could encompass enigmatic groups like the De…
articles.content: A new human species, Homo juluensis, has been proposed based on fossils from eastern Asia, dating back 300,000 to 50,000 years ago, possibly including the Denisovans. This research uses a novel metho… [+3230 chars]
